en: Then the word of the Lord came to me:

ngiemboon: «Gù míŋ nyìŋ mesoŋ, ɔ̀ kwǎŋ jú ngie nkẅíŋ gẅie é fóo na mbwó metÿǒ melùʼ, é pú ńgwɔ́ tʉ̀nzẅìŋ, ńcʉa nkẅíŋ gẅie é fóo mbɔɔ na yɛ̌ ntí mbwó tÿǒ wɔ́ɔ gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ mbím keen?
en: “Son of man, how does the wood of the vine,   that branch among the trees of the forest, compare to any other wood?

ngiemboon: Ngwɔ́ mé lɔg nkẅíŋ gẅie é fóo mǒ, ńkwóon tsɔ́ mmó? Ngwɔ́ mé lɔg ńgÿo ngwɔ̀b gie mé ge kyɛɛ mmó mǒ?
en: Can wood be taken from it to make something useful? Or can anyone make a peg from it to hang things on?

ngiemboon: É kẅéte pɔ́ ndáʼ lélɔg ńkẅíge mmɔ̌g. Emmɔ̌g gwɔ́ tà ńgwoon metwó mémbʉ́a, alʉ́me mmɔ̌g piŋ ńgwɔ́ soŋ, mbà ngwɔ́ é ké ńgíŋ ńkẅéte na kɔ́?
en: In fact, it is put into the fire as fuel.   The fire devours both of its ends, and the middle is charred. Can it be useful for anything?

ngiemboon: Mé ka zɔɔn ńgwaa tuɔ, é té ne ńkẅéte na tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́, mé gwɔ́ tà ńtuɔ, ńké ńgíŋ ńdɔg ńgÿo kɔ́?
en: Even when it was whole it could not be made into a useful object. How much less can it ever be made into anything useful when the fire has devoured it and it is charred! ”

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé n gɔ̌ɔn ngie: Mé ge maʼ nkẅíŋ gẅie é fóo na tÿǒ melùʼ lâ gẅie é fóo na metsɔ́ metÿǒ, á mmɔ̌g, à gwɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ n ge záb ngɔ́ʼ twó pʉ̀a pie é tsẅé Yelúzálèm púʼu,
en: Therefore, this is what the Lord God says, “Like the wood of the vine among the trees of the forest, which I have given to the fire as fuel, so I will give up the residents of Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: n ge lu ssé té poŋ á nzèm pɔ́b, pɔ́ kwaŋ ngie pɔ́ kẅɛɛ tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g; táʼ, emmɔ̌g zɔ ge pyága wɔ́b. Pi ge gÿo cwoŋo zsé ngie mèŋ zɔɔ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, á fʉ̀ʼ gie n du ssé té poŋ nzèm pɔ́b.
en: I will turn against them.   They may have escaped from the fire, but it will still consume them.  # 15:7 Is 24:18 And you will know that I am the Lord when I turn against them.

ngiemboon: N ge gÿo gÿo ngwòŋ wɔ́b sele ńcʉ́ʼʉ kwòŋotsẅɛ, mélàʼmie pɔ́ ka te zsé pɔ́ ndàʼ nò yɔ́ɔn mɔ́. Mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé zɔ gɔɔn.»
en: I will make the land desolate because they have acted unfaithfully.” This is the declaration of the Lord God.
